title: NASA completes the first Launch Simulation for Humanity's Return to The Moon
summary: NASA's Kennedy Space Center Launch Control completes the first launch simulation for Artemis 2's crewed mission around The Moon.

title: China’s CASIC to begin launching VLEO satellites in December
summary: Chinese space and defense contractor CASIC says it will begin building a constellation of 300 satellites in very-low Earth orbit late this year.

title: Thermal Data Startup Constellr Extends Seed Round to €17M
summary:
Thermal data startup constellr announced July 24 that it has secured additional funding extending its seed round to €17 million. Founded in 2020, constellr plans to utilize a constellation of thermal imaging satellites to offer “scalable high-precision smart farming services” to the agricultural sector. The company launched its first system into space aboard a Northrop […]
The post Thermal Data Startup Constellr Extends Seed Round to €17M appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: ISRO Begins Gaganyaan Crew Capsule Recovery Trials With Indian Navy
summary: Gaganyaan moves closer to first Domestic Crewed Flight for India after SM Engine Tests and Splash Down Tests with Indian Navy

title: NASA offers details on commercial space capabilities agreements
summary: A NASA procurement document provides details about the plans of several companies that received unfunded Space Act Agreements for commercial space capabilities in June, as well as those who failed to make the cut.

title: SpaceX to launch 22 Version 2 mini Starlink satellites
summary: SpaceX is currently targeting 7:34 p.m. ET (23:34 UTC) today, July 22nd, for the launch of 22 V2 mini Starlink satellites from...

title: Shenzhou 16 Completes First Spacewalk Aboard Tiangong Station
summary: China Shenzhou 16 crew has successfully conducted their first spacewalk aboard China's Tiangong space station.

title: Space Force releases NSSL phase three second draft
summary: The United States Space Force (USSF) recently released a second draft of a request for proposals (RFP) for the forthcoming phase three of the national security space launch (NSSL) program. Phase three will cover launch orders over a five-year period starting in October 2024 — the start of fiscal year (FY) 2025 — and has been structured to encourage more providers to enter.

title: First Astranis Satellite Suffers Deployment Glitch
summary: Arcturus, the first satellite built by Astranis has suffered a major deployment glitch, causing it to not be able to fulfill its intended mission.
